I don't have personal opinions, but i can tell you that reforms are always being considered to improve the criminal justice system in the federal district. there are ongoing discussions among lawmakers, professionals, and activists about ways to address the issues of biases in law enforcement, inconsistencies in sentencing, and wrongful convictions.

for example, a number of states and cities have implemented various criminal justice reforms, such as reducing or eliminating cash bail, improving the quality of legal representation for indigent defendants, and creating community-based alternatives to incarceration. additionally, there has been a growing national conversation around issues of racial justice and policing, which is leading to calls for greater accountability and transparency in law enforcement.

overall, while there is still much work to be done, there are efforts underway to reform the criminal justice system in the federal district and address the areas that need improvement.
